snippet: After investing $885 million on retrofits, Constellation Energy in Maryland is frustrated by a court-ordered delay on tighter pollution rules.
abstract: Constellation Energy, after investing $885 million on retrofits to reduce emissions from its coal-burning plant, says it is frustrated by a court-ordered delay on tighter pollution rules; company argues that laggard plants should also have to comply with the emissions limits or shut down, otherwise it will be operating at a big disadvantage.
lead_paragraph: After investing $885 million on retrofits, Constellation Energy in Maryland is frustrated by a court-ordered delay on tighter pollution rules.

headline.seo: Constellation Energy Coal Company Urges Stricter Pollution Rules
headline.main: A Coal-Fired Plant That Is Eager for U.S. Rules
